text:
John Alexander Gordon (August 22, 1946 – April 19, 2020) was an American politician and military personnel. He was Deputy Director of the Central Intelligence Agency. He served as the President George W. Bush's Homeland Security Advisor from 2003 to 2004.
Gordon died on April 19, 2020 in Columbia, Missouri at the age of 73.

annotations.surface_form: Deputy Director of the Central Intelligence Agency
